qas.question: What name describes the Estonian Song Festivals?
What year did the tradition of Laulupidu start?
How many people celebrated Laulupidu in 2004?
Where does Laulupidu usually take place?

context: The tradition of Estonian Song Festivals (<a0_0>Laulupidu<a0_0/>) started at the height of the Estonian national awakening in <a1_0>1869<a1_0/>. Today, it is one of the largest amateur choral events in the world. In 2004, <a2_0>about 100,000 people<a2_0/> participated in the Song Festival. Since 1928, <a3_0>the Tallinn Song Festival Grounds<a3_0/> (Lauluväljak) have hosted the event <a4_0>every five years in July<a4_0/>. The last festival took place in July 2014. In addition, Youth Song Festivals are also held every four or five years, the last of them in 2011, and the next is scheduled for 2017.
